title: The X Factor: Celebrity: Love Island stars admit they had no idea they would be put into a group
text:
The Love Island stars taking part in The X Factor: Celebrity have admitted they had no idea they would be made into a group when they first auditioned.

Wes Nelson, 21, Samira Mighty, 22, Zara McDermott, 23, and Eyal Booker, 24, all auditioned to take part in the show separately and it was only when the group was put together by producers that they saw who they will be performing with.

Speaking to MailOnline, Zara said: 'We don’t know who auditioned, but all we know is that we all auditioned individually, and then they said to us, "would you be open to being in a band?"

Surprise: The Love Island stars taking part in The X Factor: Celebrity have admitted they had no idea they would be made into a group when they first auditioned

'And I was like "yeah". Then a couple of weeks later, we walked into a room and they’re all sat there and I was like, “oh my God hi!" ’

Several other Love Island stars were also said to have auditioned for the group with Wes saying they trusted the 'process'.

He said: 'With this process, we’re completely new to this. This is not our forte, we have no expertise on this, so you just trust the process.

‘They obviously heard numerous people audition – so they put us together so they must feel we sound good together.

Group: Wes Nelson, 21, Samira Mighty, 22, Zara McDermott, 23, and Eyal Booker, 24, all auditioned separately and were put together by producers (pictured in October 2019)

‘And when we sat in the room together for the first time, we were like, “is this going to work? We don’t know?” But then when we did start to sing together, we just got stronger since.’

The group believe the fact they are already well-known before doing The X Factor could be something of a double-edged sword.

Asked if he think it will make taking part in the show more difficult, Eyal said: ‘In some ways yes, because people already have a preconception of us having been in the public eye.

'But one the other hand, maybe not because we’re used to public scrutiny and people hating on us.’

Show: Several other Love Island stars were also said to have auditioned for the group with Wes saying they trusted the 'process' (pictured in October 2019)

Samira added: ‘People talking about you positively or negatively is quite hard going in without a profile, so you need to adjust yourself to the life after, but we’ve already had the exposure.’

Other Love Island stars have been supportive of the group trying their hand as singers.

Wes said: ‘I’ve had so many in the DMs when I’ve shared it on my Stories like “oh my God, I’m so happy you’re doing it, you’re finally doing something with your voice”.

'All these Islanders were in the villa with us so they’ve heard us singing around the villa.'

Zara added: We weren’t in the villa to sing, we were there to find love so it wasn’t really in their interest to put any singing in the show I suppose.

'I don’t think they’re allowed to anyway. This is the most terrifying thing we’ve ever done.’

Fame: The group believe the fact they are already well-known before doing The X Factor could be something of a double-edged sword (pictured in October 2019)

Strictly Come Dancing's Brendan Cole and actor Jeremy Edwards, who together are known as Cole and Edwards, are also part of the groups category.

The pair admitted they likely have the least amount of singing experience out of all the celebrities taking part.

However, Jeremy did think some of the criticism directed at them from judges Randy Jackson and Howie Mendel was harsh.

He told MailOnline: 'This was just me, I can’t speak for Brendan on this… Brendan is more used to it than I am. They edited down quite a lot of what Howie said and I’m gonna be completely honest with you, I don’t think a lot of it was necessary.

'That’s all cos I don’t mind criticism, and certain things didn’t work but certain things did and there was a lot of positives there, but A, he talked for ages and B, it was negative, negative, negative.'

Contenders: Jeremy Edwards and Brendan Cole, who together are known as Cole and Edwards, are also part of the groups category (pictured in October 2019)

Brendan added: 'Luckily Nicole [Scherzinger] and Simon [Cowell] were really nice to us.'

The pair also added that they would not be too impressed if they are deemed the novelty act of this series.

Jeremy said: ‘I’d find that insulting!’

Brendan added: ‘We didn’t come on the show to be as good as everyone else. Next week there is some phenomenal singing on the airways!

‘We didn’t come in to be the best singers, that’s apparent, but all of us have got something about us. That’s why we’ve been in our different careers for so many years.'

Glee star Kevin McHale previously sang frequently as a castmember on the hit musical series.

However, the actor believes there is a big difference between singing as the character he played and now performing as himself.

Performer: Glee star Kevin McHale previously sang frequently as a castmember on the hit musical series (pictured in October 2019)

He said: 'When you’re a character you have everything to fall back on - you have the writer who made this happen, the person who chose the song and if it sucks it doesn’t matter because the character chose to do that.

'I haven’t sung live since the Glee tour in 2011 but we were singing as characters so I probably haven’t sung as myself since I was 17 which is a whole different thing, and I was in a boy band then so does that even count?’

YouTube stars Max and Harvey were already fans of The X Factor before taking part and found it surreal to audition in front of Simon.

Harvey said: ‘Honestly, just to think that is what every single contestant that has ever been on the show in the past, for what, 15 years now? It’s just completely weird and surreal.

‘Just to be at the age that we are now, to flick the switch and be in the position of all of these people, it’s crazy for us.’

The X Factor: Celebrity starts October 12 on ITV at 8.35pm.
description: Wes Nelson, 21, Samira Mighty, 22, Zara McDermott, 23, and Eyal Booker, 24, told MailOnline they all auditioned to take part in the show separately and were put together by producers.
